headline: Chicken Tacos
description: These chicken tacos are quick and easy to make. Warm the tortillas in the microwave, set out some toppings, then let everyone help themselves!

video.description: See how to make quick-and-easy chicken tacos.
video.name: Chicken Tacos

name: Chicken Tacos
recipeIngredient: 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into bite size pieces
1 (8 ounce) package shredded sharp Cheddar cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Combine chicken, lemonade, olive oil, lime juice, and Worcestershire sauce in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in garlic powder, onion powder, and bay leaf. Simmer until chicken is tender and juices run clear, 15 to 20 minutes.

Meanwhile, warm the tortillas in the oven or microwave until soft. When chicken is fully cooked, transfer to serving bowl. Place chopped tomatoes, lettuce, cheese, salsa, and sour cream in serving dishes. Each person can create their own wrap, using their preferred ingredients.

review.reviewBody: waz messy lol but totally good :D
The chicken was too sweet. Next time I will try using half lemonade and half chicken broth, and add cilantro and cumin.
easy and tasty

Doubled down on the garlic... because... dah Garlic!!Did add a base of diced tomatoes to stew it with [3 medium tomatoes to be exact] and changed out the hot stuff with a favourite hot sauce of mine - Wreck Peach - only available in Canada at present ...sorry to say
Chicken Tacos by caliboo. Kids liked, but it needs work.

I followed the recipe exactly, and the chicken didn’t taste bad, it just didn’t taste like anything (besides chicken). There wasn’t really any flavor added by the cooking method. I saw some reviewers cooked it down to add more flavor, but I don’t really like overcooked meat, so...

We love this recipe. We made it last night for the first time in about 9 months & I had forgotten how delicious & easy this was! We do add 1/2TSP of Taco Seasoning. I do NOT think this recipe is enough for 8 servings. We made 50% more and barely had enough for 4 people, so keep that in mind. (We used mini tortillas & had enough for about 8 tacos).
Very tasty! The only change I made was to add one finely chopped jalapeno to the meat mixture to add a little heat. My husband and I both loved it!
I LOVE this dish. I let it simmer a bit longer until the liquid is gone. It gives a nice coating on the chicken
I used a rice mixture as a filling with the chicken. I was cooking on a budget.

Really good! I switched the steak sauce out for more lime and cumin, and marinated that for an hour like the top comment suggested. turned out really tasty, even if I forgot to use the sour cream and salsa!
Easy and delicious.

Made this tonight. After reading several of the reviews, I opted to double the batch, using 3 lb of boneless, skinless chicken thighs instead of chicken breast, and added 1 lb of extra small peeled and deveined shrimp. Used Limeade rather than lemonade. Tasted halfway through, and was a bit bland. So, I added lime juice, cumin and paprika to taste. Let the sauce cook away, and this made a tremendous flavored filling.

Served with chopped red onion, guacamole, sour cream, mild cheddar, lettuce, and choice of sriacha and verde sauce.

This is now going into my keeper recipes and will get added into rotation of meals for me and my boys.
It turned out great! I added a couple teaspoons of taco seasoning as well to give it some spice.
Excellent!
Very bland and watery... Should have guessed it by the ingredients.
I made this exactly how the recipe is and it was very good. The chicken had a nice flavor and was tender. I will make this again!
So good! I've made this with chicken breast and canned chicken and both turned out great!

Great recipe! Everyone loved it at my dinner party. I did add some chili powder and cumin. I simmered until most of the liquid evaporated.Once finished I refrigerated until the following day. I wanted to shred the chicken so when I cut the breast pieces up initially I left them a little larger. When I reheated the next day, I shredded the meat and then added a little chicken broth.to keep it moist as it reheated. Thanks s dish was a HUGE hit at my Taco bar party!
Very tasty. I used raspberry lemonade because that is what I had. I didn't have Worcestershire sauce so I used soy sauce. It worked really well.

Made as per recipe, substituted tomatos with salsa. I added good squirt of Siracha to sauce, added light dusting of chilantro to finished chicken. Served with micro warmed white corn tortillas... Delicious!

Very good as written. One of my kids thought it was a little too lemony, but everyone else loved it. There weren't even leftovers. I was really looking forward to using it in a quesadilla! Next time, I'll make more!
This recipe has a lot of flavor and is really fast and easy. It's a favorite of the whole family! We make it at least twice a month.

Like other reviews have said, I didn't include the Worcestershire sauce and instead included traditional Mexican food spices (cumin, chili pepper flakes, etc). I also swapped out the lemonade for 1/2 cup lemonade, 1/2 cup water. Next time, I'll increase the lemonade so the citrus flavor will come through a little stronger. Do what other reviewers have also said- let the "sauce" reduce to almost nothing. Wonderful!

Very good chicken tacos! I followed (and am rating) the original recipe, but made the following adjustments: Lemon juice instead of lime juice, added fresh garlic, added chili powder, cumin, and sea salt (as per other reviewerss suggestions)
These tacos were really good. So easy.
Didn't use the worcestershire sauce. In-Place, used the seasonings of another reviewer. Found this to be a very good recipe. Will make again and put in the cookbook at home!

Pretty much made it exactly as the recipe, except I put it under the broiler on low for some crispness. The flavor was good, but it's missing something. I wonder if you put it in the slow cooker and shredded the chicken instead of cubes. I don't know if it needs cilantro rice or what, but it needs something.
This was the blandest chicken ever.

Bland at best. I was faithful to the recipe (as I always do the first time) and even with all of those wonderful flavors in there I just wasn't impressed. I had a bunch of chicken breasts that needed to be cooked so I doubled the recipe; it was like having boiled chicken...I wanted to reduce it but there was just sooooo much liquid. If I make it again I'll add some spices that others recommended to liven it up.

We loved this recipe. I did exactly as the recipe said. I ended up making my own lemonade. Consisted of 1 cup of water, 1/4 cup sugar and half of a large lemon. Next time I will use less sugar. It was a little sweet but love love this recipe! We will definitely be making this again!
Chicken was very bland. Kids would not eat it.

This is one of the most labor-intensive recipes to make. A lot of chopping and dicing, then waiting for the chicken to cook on the stove, then the assembly of the tacos -- I would not call this quick . But it does taste good once you assemble everything. One way to make it quick and easy for a weeknight dinner would be to chop and prepare the ingredients ahead of time and refrigerate them until needed. Then just assemble the tacos and reheat.
I made this , I really didn't taste any flavor ..I thought maybe I made. a mistake..Going to try again.
Too much lemon for me. Not a fan. :(

Pretty good! Just made these tonight for taco Tuesday 
I let the juice cook down and simmer in the lemonade sauce mixture. 
Topped with taco sauce, pico de gallo, shredded sharp cheddar, sour cream and shredded lettuce! 
I will make this again.
I think the next time I will use natural lemon juice with a bit less sugar or maybe add some type of spicy seasoning.
Not for us. Way to sweet. No salt. My 2 year old eats anything and even she thought it wasn't good.
Made just as the recipe called for. Grand Kids loved them. Will be making these again.
For me, was not the "taco chicken" taste I was used to or expecting. My husband liked it though.

Like most other reviewers, I added a few things to the recipe. First of all, I marinated the chicken in olive oil, minced garlic, salt, pepper and chili pepper for an hour. Afterwards, I added a little olive oil to a skillet, let it heat up, then added the chicken. After a few minutes of it simmering, I added a few splashes of lemonade, lime juice and wostershire sauce. I added some cilantro, more chili pepper and chopped white onions as well. 

Total time in skillet was around 15 minutes.
Never again. Way too sweet. I will stick with my regular home made tacof recipe.

I Love this recipe. I used 1.5 lbs because that's what i had on hand and I think that was the perfect amount for all the juice that was with it and the recommended cooking time. I also made with white rice and poured some of the juice on it. I added a little salt while it was cooking and made my own lemonade" with lemon juice water and sugar yo taste. Will definately share recipe with friends and make 
Again!!
Was easy. Was easy to make half for recipe. Will definitely try again. Chicken would be good on a salad also.

This recipe is awesome. I swap out the chicken breast for ground chicken, add green onions and cut a lime in half and put it right in with the chicken to cook. This makes a great dinner and is incredible for salads during the week. I recommend this to everyone.
This recipe was excellent! I used already cooked chicken to make it quicker for my family of 6 and added cilantro. My family demolished it! Great.
I used left-over grilled chicken and loved the outcome!
This is a great recipe I twicked it a bit lemon juice only & avocado & fresh garlic ... I go with what's taste good for me ...
So easy to make and it was really tasty. My 3 yr old loved helping me make and eat these chicken tacos.
Didn't have lemonade, used a can of Fresca and added chipotle Tabasco sauce...served as part of a potluck, this was a hit!

They where ok, very lemony, I think they would have been great if I was in the mood for them. They didn't look appealing would be my complaint and the mind is tricky. They could have been great but I don't know, they needed something and most people tweaked them a bit so in conclusion the recipe needed tweeking so go with a difererent recipe or use this one for a base.

I made these tacos for dinner tonight and they came out delicious! I didn't fry the tortillas, just heated them open flame. And mixed the raw chicken with the seasonings before putting it in the pan to cook. This made sure that everything was well mixed together first. I also added sour cream to my toppings. Yummmmm!!!
try marinating chicken for a few hours and oven baking for healthier low fat option
Loved it! Next time I would use 1/2 cup fresh squeezed lemon juice and 1/2 cup water. It was delicious!!!! Also, I used Chobani Greek yogurt and Ezekial fajitas to make it healthy :)
We liked it! "This chicken is so good. I want this chicken in my tacos every time." - these are the reviews from my house. I will make this again.
I used less lemonade, no Worcestershire sauce, and more lemon juice and lime juice. Delicious!

I made this tonight. It was tasty. Sweeter than I thought probably due to the lemonade since I used simply brand. Kids liked it. My picky eater ate it and she normally wont. I marked it as OK because I might make it again... but it won't be at the top of my list.

I would give this 5 stars, but I kind of altered this recipe more than normal so I will give it 4. I don't know how it would taste as is..but I think Worchestershire sauce is gross soooooo.....
I used a about a teaspoon of Mccormick taco seasonsing instead...I mixed that, the lemonade (I used that Simply Lemonade) lime juice, the taco seasoning, garlic power, onion powder, olive oil and about a teaspoon of sugar. I marinated the chicken with this for about 30 minutes then put it all in pan and simmered down until it was cooked. 
On a side note...I sauteed mushrooms with a little garlic salt, olive oil and a little whipped butter to serve with it and my boyfriend literally ate 3 tacos and all the mushrooms before I even sat down with mine. 
Hope this helps and enjoy!
I was able to salvage something I wasn't too embarrassed to call a taco, adding ancho powder, cumin and chili powder

Absolutely delicious flavor! However, you will need to add salt. Not sure why the recipe doesn't call for any. I also added a bit of cumin and some red pepper flakes. Don't worry that it will be too sweet, it's not. Will definitely make this again and again!
It is so quick and easy. I got it done in no time, we are definitely eating this again.

I saw the the Worcester sauce which was a big red flag but with all the four star reviews I gave the recipe a chance, thinking maybe it would be something special. Boy was I wrong, The The Worcester sauce made the chicken taste like beef which clashed with lemon and lime flavors. The meal had a dirty confusing taste that was barely palatable. I would have had a more balanced and enjoyable meal if I went to Taco Bell. The food was edible but not enjoyable. Next time i'll read more negative reviews before deciding on a meal.

I enjoyed the smokey flavor the Worcestershire added. Lemon juice was fine instead of Lemonade. I also made a pico de gallo with the sides along with the sliced iceberg lettuce. Laying the tortillas on a hot(electric) burner for a few seconds will give them a nice charred effect. Be careful tho! Lift off with a metal spatula. Wanted to add Avocado but forgot to buy a ripe one!
I really loved this recipe just as it was written- the best part was the simmering with the lemonade mixture, ended up being poached and a little sweet-really yummy.
These were disappointingly flavorless :/

Not bad - I tried doing this in the crock pot with less liquid - 2 T. lemon juice, 2 T. lime juice, and 1/4 c. water. Cooked it on high for 4 hours, but of course not enough liquid evaporated in the crock pot. Had to simmer it on the stove for about 10 minutes to boil it off. Kids liked it a lot, though! I might try again with just the juices and no water. I also added 1T. chili powder for a little kick, and I might add more next time.
Pretty good! Only thing I'd have to say is that the meat is a twinge too sweet. I'll try something different next time to cut the sweetness out. But very easy to make and quick.
I was dissapointed. It was very bland.
Liked it, but added spices - it is bland without. Added Frank's hot sauce, chili powder and black pepper.
OK recipe, not something that I would constantly do, but it is a nice way to have chicken. Did the original recipe, maybe next time I will take some feedback from the reviews. Overall an ok recipe

I heavily modified this recipe because I didn't like the artificial, acerbic flavors of the garlic and onion powder or the Worcestershire sauce. Instead I put the sliced chicken in a bath of lemon juice (2 lemons per whole chicken breast,) cumin (3tbs,) paprika (1tbs,) cilantro (2tbs,) and 2 cloves minced garlic. I'm not against adding a lime, but they are expensive and I don't really taste it over the lemon juice. Even better would be to use fresh cilantro but I don't often have it on-hand. Then the whole thing goes in the skillet for about 6 minutes. I really try hard not to overcook the chicken because everybody hates dry chicken tacos.

I changed a few things, and have made it several times in the past month. Use Limeade instead of lemonade, omit the extra lime juice, drop the bay leaf. Mince fresh cilantro (about a tablespoon worth?) and add half a packet of hot taco seasoning. I also simmer everything a little longer to reduce the sauce so it's thicker. I love this meal.

These would be really good if they weren't so sweet. The lemon and lime gives the chicken a wonderful citrus flare but the sugar from the lemon jucie makes you stop and wonder if you were supposed to taste that. Next time I'll use lemon water instead of lemonade.
This chicken is delicious. It's my favorite way to cook chicken when I make Mexican food

Love this recipe. Very flavorful. Perfect for a hot summer night as it is quick (no oven, no standing over a hot stove for long) and it is very light. I used canned chicken breast - cooks quicker and very easy to shred.
Was a decent dish. I should have let the chicken marinade in the lemon/lime longer.

This is excellent, but try this, instead of the worcester sauce, after cooking the chicken add one packet of taco mix and 1 cup of water or broth. Let it come to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes (add more water if necessary). Absolutely better than ground beef.
Yummy!! I used lemon juice instead of lemonade and omitted the bay leaf. I added olives and used spinach instead of lettuce because of what I had on hand
My family LOVED this recipe! I did add an extra half lime, and a couple of extra dashes of Worcestershire.
delicious. i didnt have lemonade so i used a little pineapple juice and sugar and also added a little taco seaoning. it was most excellent will be making again soon!

https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/37906/chicken-tacos/Three from me. Close to a five from those kids. I used homemade lemonade so it wasn't too sweet, or really sour either. I used three pieces with same amounts except decreased garlic to 1/4t. Simmered till done then removed the chicken to a plate; increased heat to reduce to a thin gravy consistency. Sliced the chicken & added it back. Cooked till very little liquid le ... ft. Tasted & thought "That was a waste of time." so added some salt, pepper, a tsp taco seasoning. Still bland. Added more taco seasoning & wasn't impressed yet. 'Went to work & came home the kids said it'd be okay if I made it again. "You're kidding" "No." :? :) Go figure. The kids, 12 & 14, liked it.
Way too sweet!
I do not cook, but I decide to try something new such as making a meal. My family loved it.. I followed the directions to the T and it was perfect. Thank You :)
followed exactly, next time will probably change things up a bit to cut down on the tangy aftertaste
My husband loved them; Very simple recipe.

We loved these! I didn't have onion powder so I finely sliced 3 green onions and added a small handful of cilantro. My husband and kids said flour tortillas would be good, our corn ones fell apart. So, instead, next time I will put a bit of shortening in a skillet and heat them up that way, they'll be less likely to fall apart I think. We also had sliced avocado and chopped cilantro.

I am a Diabetic so I used the juice of fresh lemons plus added a tablespoon of lemon juice in the bottle. I added 3/4 cup of water. I also added real onions in addition to the onion powder. I used cabbage instead of lettuce and it worked just fine. (I was out of lettuce)
Next time I might skip the Worcestershire and experiment with other spices. 
All in all- pretty tasty. (although my girlfriend would want it to be SPICY!) She can just add some cayenne!

Low rating, but that could be my fault. i tried to use up some leftover cooked chicken breast and use the ingredients to make a sauce to go over---but it didn't work at all on account of simply making the already shredded chicken soggy. i'll try it again and follow recipe exactly for a more accurate rating next time.

I didn't really get a lot of flavor out of the chicken in this recipe. If it had a flavor, it was masked with all the toppings. It definitely wasn't bad. You can't really go wrong with chicken tacos. But if you were expecting a home run with this recipe, it wasn't it. You could have just boiled chicken and end up with about the same outcome.

My kids loved the chicken -they called it "Lemonade Chicken!" I simmered most of the liquid down so the flavor was really concentrated. It tasted like candy chicken. It was too sweet for me. Next time I might try to cut the lemonade w/ straight lemon juice.

This was lovely & people raved. I used 1 tsp soy sauce instead of 1.5 tsp worcestershire sauce. I cut it down to 1 Tbsp olive oil. I also used more ingredients in the taco seasoning portion, including chili powder, paprika, red pepper flakes. I forgot the bay leaf and am curious what that would have added. The dinner was an absolute hit but I would have liked even more of a kick in the seasoning and will play with that in the future.

Don't change a thing! I tried suggestions in other reviews and it was just not right.
If you want to spice the taco up use salsa.
The meat is perfect the way it is done.
Definitely add some chili powder cumin and salt!

Loved it! Make it just as it is! If you don't have lemonade, use fresh lemons and some sugar. Loved the combination of Worcester sauce and lemonade! Don't listen to the naysayers who want to "spice it up" with the traditionally boring taco spices. This recipe is great as is and I will definitely make it again!
I wasn't to please with this recipe
These were a hit! My husband loved these. Very tasty, but the flavor wasn't overpowering. And easy to make too. I think this is a new family staple. Def will make again.

I really don't get this one. It's not that the chicken wasn't good, it just didn't taste like chicken tacos should taste. The meat was too sweet (definitely the lemonade). I even added some pepper, salt, chili powder, and a little bit of crushed pepper. I wouldn't make this again.

These chicken tacos were AMAZING!! As I do with several recipes, when they only call for a couple seasonings, I still add to it. In addition to the garlic & onion powder, I added Tony Chachere's Original Creole Seasoning, black pepper, a little cayenne pepper. I used Simply Lemonade & ReaLime juice. You MUST allow the liquid to reduce and the chicken should be juicy...mine was!! I will definitely cook this again.
The chicken was so amazing. It could use some better toppings though
The tart flavor did not do it for me. This wasn't terrible, but I guess I prefer something more spicy.
